website_summaries.verdict: The KEF Q350 bookshelf speaker looks exquisite, and sounds bigger and more expensive than it really is.
pros: The relatively affordable KEF Q350 speaker sounds good with almost everything, and offers an excellent sense of depth and space in decent recordings
cons: The Q350 doesn't come with grill covers, but KEF will sell you a pair for extra cost
Competitors such as Klipsch and Elac sound more exciting

customer_reviews.title: You have to order 2 speaker Grilles for $50...
customer_reviews.text: HEADS UP. . . The speaker grille is only for one speaker. Don't get confused by the picture like I did and think it's for a pair. It's kinda ridiculous the speakers dont already come with grilles but for $25 after tax I figured I'd buy some just in case. $50 is pushing it tho and is pretty absurd especially after already spending so much on the speakers... 1 star for the fact that they are gouging us for speaker covers, but the speakers themselves get 5 stars for sound/ build quality. Thus my 3 star review
customer_reviews.author: ErikRoyce

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful design. Love the fact the KEF logo is in black on black plaque. Looks absolutely chic, sophisticated and modern. The box is very well built. For some reason, I thought "Uni-Q Driver Array" type on the speaker rim would be back lit, but wasn't. I am very happy that it wasn't. Sounds extremely clear. Hi and Mid are smooth and rich. Wish there is a bit more bass, but perhaps adding subwoofer is better idea anyways. It does what it suppose to do very well. Great product. Very satisfied. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Daisuke Endo

customer_reviews.title: The Q350's Take Time to Break In
customer_reviews.text: I've been listening to the Q350's for about five weeks and the woofers are still not broken in; that warm speaker feel and sound hasn't come to fruition yet. I'm confident with more time they'll loosen up, and warm with time. I use an iPad Mini 4 as the sound source and have found the "rock" setting in the equalizer sounds best overall. The integrated amp I use is the Yamaha AS-801 and I need to turn the bass knob to about "two o'clock" to get the warmth I like to hear. The only track I've seen to actually work and move the woofers is Rocket Empire's 'Cruising the Galaxy', loud.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: true power rating 35 watts rms
customer_reviews.text: FDog i split in ha;lf this UK made B.S at half rated power check . they couldnt break my american made spekerr tho,
customer_reviews.author: northsidelunatic

customer_reviews.title: the grille and speaker reviews are in p;ace
customer_reviews.text: i have bought kef speakers for decades. Q series that is. And they always came with the grilles Somehow kef decided to make you buy the grilles separately. that's 50 bucks for 2. however the q 350 is one of the best speakers ever at that price level. That's the deal with kef at this price level you cannot do better however at higher levels you have many speakers equal to their r and ref series. I would say the r series is probably one of the best also in it's price range and the ref too. but if you have the speakers you need these so get em.
customer_reviews.author: Michael DobeyTop Contributor: Rock Music

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing short of excellent! These speakers are so crisp! Great lows, mids, and highs. But if you purchase these speakers you have to get the 650 center speaker. Together they create the perfect harmony. If not, you can’t go wrong with these two alone. I’m extremely happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bolden

customer_reviews.title: Great Sounding Speakers
customer_reviews.text: For small bookshelf speakers, they deliver wide deep bass, smooth sound from top to bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Regan T. Powell

customer_reviews.title: We’ll receive 1 or 2 pieces?
customer_reviews.text: I received only one piece and it was supposed to be two, as in the photo posted.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuelle Quintana

customer_reviews.title: Matched with Rockville Bluetube or ACIN hybrid tube amp is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: These speakers only need 15 watts !! And they just sound so incredibly good.
customer_reviews.author: Bachman-Electro

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers!
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are amazing. I compared these to speakers against many other brands and these we my favorite by far! Work great for music and movies. These dont come with grills, but Im really not sure who would want to cover these beauties.
customer_reviews.author: Pool Man

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. Many scratches on delivery. Personally not worth $20.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C

customer_reviews.title: Uniq all around with kef sub sounds fantastic. Incredibly detailed
customer_reviews.text: Uniq all around with kef sub sounds fantastic. Incredibly detailed. With a high quality recordings the speakers literally disappear. Soundstage is per side and with a good movie seems to extend beyond the speakers. Because the sound is so detailed the 3d rendering of a really good movie can now be perceived vividly. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald williams

customer_reviews.title: Good looking speakers though
customer_reviews.text: I tried it but decided to go for Martin Logan 35XT. Good looking speakers though.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fung

customer_reviews.title: Highly rated but.....
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting much from these speakers. After reading several positive reviews in a handful of trade publications I went ahead and took the plunge. They are priced moderately and perform well however I must admit their sound is not exceptional. No they are not bad but somewhere between better than average...(way better really) and good. A little thin -- something of substance is lacking. Stereophile Magazine has given them a very strong review as one of their recommended components. Maybe with certain amps or other associated equipment that is true. I can only say in my system I find them lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good bass
customer_reviews.text: so i bought these about a year ago, they sound good, lots of bass, loose sum detail at lower volumes. overall pleased and would recommend, great price point, well built
customer_reviews.author: Kris

product_meta.title: KEF Q350 Bookshelf Speakers (Pair, White) (Q350WH)
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteThe KEF Q350 bookshelf speaker, the bigger brother of the KEF Q150, incorporates and successfully builds upon everything KEF fans have come to know and love about the bookshelf speaker. The New Q350 boasts a revamped Unit-Q driver array with a damped tweeter loading tube designed to smooth out treble frequencies, and reimagined crossovers to provide cleaner and more accurate bass. Architecturally, the Q350 benefits from a New port, which has been moved to the rear of the speaker to improve audio clarity, and the Unit-Q driver array has been relocated to the middle of the cabinet to reduce unwanted internal resonances. These changes between the Q300 and Q350 have transformed an already breathtaking bookshelf speaker into one that truly needs to be heard to be believed. The Q350 is available in sleek matte black and White vinyl finishes. Grilles for the Q350 are sold separately.
feature_bullets: The KEF Q350 Bookshelf Speaker is the newest iteration of KEF award-winning Q Series. The Q350 features a new cabinet, sleek new finishes, and an improved 6.5” Uni-Q driver Array.
The Q350 contains an enhanced Uni-Q driver Array designed to smooth out treble frequencies, and reimagined crossovers to provide cleaner and more accurate bass.
The front port has been moved to the back of the Q350 and internal architecture has been redesigned to reduce internal resonances to improve audio clarity. Nominal Impedance : 8 Ohms (min 3.7 Ohms)
The Q350 is available in sleek matte Black and White vinyl finishes.
